alert.note: Alert for Fannin; Whitfield (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 13 at 8:30PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of central Gilmer, Murray, eastern Whitfield and northwestern Fannin Counties through 900 PM EDT... At 830 PM EDT, a line of strong thunderstorms was along a line extending from near Cohutta Wilderness to near Conasauga Lake to near Carters, and moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...40 to 50 mph wind, up to penny sized hail, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Dalton, Chatsworth, Ellijay, Blue Ridge, Eton, Cohutta, East Ellijay, Morganton, Crandall, Sumac, Jones Mill, Higdon, Gregory, Cohutta Wilderness, Epworth, Conasauga Lake, Beaverdale, Mineral Bluff, Cherry Log, and Fort Mountain State Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning.
